block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
Theater

CROTON FALLS -- Staged readings of ''Beauty Queen of Leenane'' by Martin McDonough. Today at 4 p.m. and Friday at 8 p.m. ''Skylights'' by David Hare. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. ''Unexpected Man'' by Yasmina Reza. Next Sunday at 4 p.m. Donation: $12 each. The Schoolhouse, Owens Road, off Route 22. (914) 277-8477.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
Theater

CROTON FALLS -- Staged readings of ''Beauty Queen of Leenane'' by Martin McDonough. Today at 4 p.m. and Friday at 8 p.m. ''Skylights'' by David Hare. Next Saturday at 8 p.m. ''Unexpected Man'' by Yasmina Reza. Next Sunday at 4 p.m. Donation: $12 each. The Schoolhouse, Owens Road, off Route 22. (914) 277-8477.

ELMSFORD -- ''Sound of Music.'' Show-only performances. Wednesdays at 8 p.m. Through Aug. 2. Tickets: $30; children 16 and younger, $20; with limit of two children accompanying each adult. Thursdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m., with dinner at 6; Sundays at 7 p.m., with dinner at 5. Matinees Wednesdays and Thursdays at 1 p.m., with lunch at 11:30 a.m. and Sundays at 1:30 p.m., with lunch at noon. Tickets: $46 to $66, with discounts for students, people 62 and older and children at select performances. Westchester Broadway Theater. (914) 592-2222.

GARRISON -- Hudson Valley Shakespeare Festival presenting ''Measure for Measure.'' Today at 6 p.m., Wednesday at 7 p.m. and next Sunday at 6 p.m. ''Taming of the Shrew.'' Previews Thursday and Friday at 7 p.m. Opens next Saturday at 8 p.m. Through Aug. 27. Tickets: $17 to $30. Discounts available (except Saturday evenings) for students, people 65 and older and children. Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-9575.

MAMARONECK -- ''The Mysterious Mr. Love.'' Today at 2 and 7 p.m. Tickets: $24; matinee, $20. ''A Couple of Blaguards.'' Next Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. and next Sunday at 2 and 7 p.m. $28; matinee, $23. Emelin Theater, Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.
NEW ROCHELLE -- ''The Comedy of Errors.'' Tonight and Thursday through next Sunday at 8 p.m. Free. Lawn of Fleetwood Stage, 44 Wildcliff Drive. (914) 654-8533.

NEW ROCHELLE -- ''The Heiress.'' Tonight and Friday through next Sunday at 8 p.m. Neil Simon's ''Star-Spangled Girl.'' Wednesday at 8 p.m. ''Macbeth.'' Thursday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $5. Iona College. (914) 633-2606.

YONKERS -- ''Fables of the Caribbean,'' performed in English and Spanish by Teatro Pregones, accompanied by two musicians. Next Saturday at 7 p.m. Free. Lincoln Park, South Broadway and McLean Avenue. (914) 966-1219.

YORKTOWN HEIGHTS -- The musical ''1776.'' Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $22; Yorktown residents, $20; students and people 62 and older, $18; children, $12. Yorktown Community Cultural Center, Veterans Road, off Commerce Street. (914) 962-0606.
Music and Dance
DOBBS FERRY -- Mark Morganelli and the Jazz Forum All-Stars. Wednesday at 6:30 p.m. Free. Waterfront Park. (914) 631-1000.
EASTCHESTER -- Westchester Band; Dr. Joseph Albright, conductor. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Lawn of Eastchester Town Hall, Mill Road. (914) 723-7171.
FORDHAM -- ''Nights in Latin America,'' concert by Carlos Franzetti Quartet. Today at 4 p.m. Free. McGinley Center, Fordham University, Bronx Rose Hill Campus. (718) 601-7399.

GOLDENS BRIDGE -- Folk dancing led by Jim Gold. Friday at 8:30 p.m. Admission: $6. ''Hootenanny in the Barn.'' Next Saturday at 8:30 p.m. Admission: $8. Goldens Bridge Community Center Barn, Hall Avenue. (914) 232-1862.
GREENBURGH -- Concert for adults and teenagers by a cappella oldies group, the Magic Touch. Today at 6 p.m. Tickets: $5; members, $3. Lawn of Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.

HASTINGS-ON-HUDSON -- ''Mozart.con,'' an all-Mozart concert by Westchester Philharmonic; Paul Lustig Dunkel, music director. Tonight at 7. Free. Zinsser Park. (Rain location, Hastings High School.) (914) 682-3707, ext. 10.
KATONAH -- Jazz by Ken Wessel Quartet. Wednesday 6:30 p.m. Rain or shine. Free. Garden of Katonah Museum of Art, Route 22 at Jay Street. (914) 232-9555.

KATONAH -- Misha Dichter's piano master class. Thursday at 4:30 p.m. Tickets: $15. Avalon String Quartet performing works by Mozart and Brahms and the world premiere of Augusta Read Thomas's ''Fugitive Star,'' with Ms. Thomas speaking about it. Friday from 6:30 to 7:30 (one-hour intermission) and 8:30 to 9:30 p.m. Tickets: $25. (With a buffet dinner at 7:30 p.m. Additional $35. Reservations required. (914) 232-5510.) Jazz festival. Next Saturday, with Frank Kimbrough and Joe Locke at 2 p.m., Yusef Lateef and Adam Rudolph at 3:15, Stefon Harris Quartet at 4:30, Jackie McLean Quartet with Gary Bartz at 5:45, dinner break at 6:45, followed by the Chucho Valdes Quintet at 8 p.m. Tickets: $40. Orchestra of St. Luke's; Maximiano Valdes, conductor; Leonidas Kavakos, violinist. Works by Copland, Prokofiev and Haydn. Next Sunday at 4:30 p.m., with preconcert of American tunes at 3:30. Tickets: $15 to $45. Caramoor, Girdle Ridge Road, off Route 22. (914) 232-1252.
MAMARONECK -- Big band music by the Fairfield Counts. Tonight at 7. (Rain date, tomorrow.) Free. Harbor Island Park. (914) 777-7722.
MAMARONECK -- Folk singer, Catie Curtis. Thursday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $22. Emelin Theater, Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.
MOUNT VERNON -- Mark Morganelli and the Jazz Forum All-Stars, featuring saxophonist, Harold Ousley. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Hartley Park, Gramatan and East Lincoln Avenues. (914) 631-1000.

NYACK -- Neil Berg's ''Broadway in Concert,'' with Broadway stars, a children's chorus and two dancers performing music from ''The Phantom of the Opera,'' ''Rent'' and more. Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $30 and $35. Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center, 117 Main Street. (845) 358-6333.
NYACK -- Jazz by tenor saxophonist, Gary Keller, and his quintet. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Garden of Hopper House Art Center, 82 North Broadway. (845) 358-0774.

PAWLING -- Tom Conlon Band with guest artist, Dan Pelletier. Tonight at 8. Tickets: $15; members, $12.50. Carey Bell Blues Band. Friday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $20; members, $17.50. Jimmy Dale Gilmore Band. Next Saturday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $25; members, $22.50. Towne Crier Cafe, 130 Route 22. (845) 855-1300.

PURCHASE -- Dance to the sounds of the Gerard Carelli Orchestra, performing music of Tommy Dorsey, Frank Sinatra, Bobby Darin and Count Basie. Thursday at 6:30 p.m. Free. In front of Neuberger Museum of Art, Purchase College. (914) 251-6100.
RIVERDALE -- ''Nights in Latin America,'' concert by Carlos Franzetti Quartet. Today at 2 p.m. Free. Rockwood Drive Circle, Van Cortlandt Park. (718) 601-7399.
SCARSDALE -- Westchester Band; Dr. Joseph Albright, conductor. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free. Chase Park. (914) 723-7171.

SOMERS -- Outdoor jazz concert. Friday from noon to 2 p.m. Free. (914) 232-9511. ''Mozart and More,'' Philharmonia Virtuosi, performing works by Mozart and Dvorak; Richard Kapp, music director. Next Saturday at 6 p.m. Tickets: $10; children 17 and younger, $3. (914) 693-5595. Lasdon Park, Route 35.

VALHALLA -- Organist and vocalist, Sarah McLawler, and ''Les Femmes Jazz'' group's salute to Duke Ellington. Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $15; students and people 60 and older, $12; children, free. Student center lounge, Westchester Community College. (914) 785-6262.
WHITE PLAINS -- White Plains Recreation Pops Band; Alfred A. Renino, director. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. Druss Park. (914) 422-1336.

YONKERS -- Sloan Wainwright Band. Friday from 8 to 10 p.m. Tickets: $10; with viewing of exhibits and Glenview Mansion from 5 to 8 and planetarium show at 7 p.m.; members, $5; children, free. Refreshments available. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
Children
BEDFORD -- Nature hike for children 5 and older. Next Sunday at 2 p.m. Free. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.

BRONX PARK -- Summer train show, with model engines chugging up rocky, wooded hillsides and winding among flowers and intricately designed replicas of homes of America's storytellers and artists, including Laura Ingalls Wilder's little house on the prairie, Frank Lloyd Wright's Romeo and Juliet windmill and the farmhouse from Grant Wood's ''American Gothic.'' Discover the structures animals weave, burrow, shape and sculpture at ''Animals as Architects,'' a hands-on science exhibit. Activities include hunting for gophers, creating spider-web rubbings and visiting an African termite mound. All at the children's adventure garden. ''Exotic Courtyard Garden,'' lush aquatics and tropical plants displayed in the pools and planters of the Enid A. Haupt Conservatory courtyard. Also examine the lowland and upland rain forests, deserts of Africa and the Americas and the ''Palms of the Americas Gallery,'' at the conservatory. Grounds admission: $3; students and people 62 and older, $2; children 2 through 12, $1. Free grounds admission all day on Wednesdays and from 10 a.m. to noon on Saturdays. Children's adventure garden admission: additional, $3; students and people 62 and older, $2; children, $1. Conservatory admission: $3.50; students and people 62 and older, $2.50; children, $2. Garden Passport, including grounds admission, conservatory, tram tour and children's garden: $10; students and people 62 and older, $7.50; children 2 through 12, $4. Garden hours: Tuesdays through Sundays and Monday holidays from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. New York Botanical Garden, 200th Street and Kazimiroff Boulevard. (718) 817-8700.
ELMSFORD -- 1950's rock-and-roll concert with ''Squeaky Clean.'' Next Saturday at 1 and 3 p.m. Tickets: $12. Westchester Broadway Theater. (914) 592-2222.
HARRISON -- Children's entertainer, Graham Clarke, with his new guitar, Bluebell. Thursday at 2 p.m. Free. West Harrison Library. (914) 948-2092.
HARTSDALE -- Picnic for developmentally disabled children. Wednesday from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. (Rain date, Thursday.) Free. Registration. Ridge Road Park. (914) 347-4409.

MOUNT VERNON -- Demonstration of caring for wounded during the Revolutionary War. Wednesday from 12:15 to 1 p.m. Free. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

NEW ROCHELLE -- Israeli songs and dances by Cantor Uri Aqua and others. For children 6 and older and adults. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. ''Summer Fun Show,'' clowning, comedy, juggling and mime by Sigrido Aguilar. For children 4 and older and their families. Friday at 1:30 p.m. Free. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.

NYACK -- The show ''Broadway Kids Sing Broadway.'' Friday at 10:30 a.m. and 1 p.m. and next Saturday at 12:30 and 2:30 p.m. Tickets: $11. Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center, 117 Main Street. (845) 358-6333.

OSSINING -- Hike in search of fireflies' courting for future mates. For all ages. Next Saturday from 7:30 to 8:30 p.m. Cost: $6; members, $4. Registration. Bring flashlight. Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.
RYE -- Fireworks. Wednesdays and Fridays at 9:15 p.m. Parking: $4. Playland Park. (914) 925-2700.

RYE -- Informative program of plant uses of yesterday and today. Next Saturday from 1:30 to 2:30 p.m. Cost: $6; members, $3; families, $10; member families, $6. Registration. Rye Nature Center. (914) 967-5150.
SOMERS -- ''Which Came First, the Chicken or the Egg?'' Poultry program with children's activities. Next Sunday from noon to 3 p.m. Free. Muscoot Farm, Route 100. (914) 232-7118.

WHITE PLAINS -- Songs and stories with Zak Morgan. For children 5 and older and their families. Wednesday at 7 p.m. ''Puzzles, Puppets and Parachutes.'' Program for children 3 and 4. Thursday at 10:30 a.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Ave. (914) 422-1476.

YONKERS -- Sky shows: ''Sky Tonight.'' Today and next Saturday and Sunday at 1:30 p.m. ''Rusty Rocket's Last Blast.'' Today and next Saturday and Sunday at 2:30 p.m. ''Guided by the Sky,'' new planetarium show takes to the seas, sky and wilderness with the sun and stars as the guides. For children 8 and older and adults. Today and next Saturday and Sunday at 3:30 p.m. Admission: $4 each; people 62 and older and children, $3; with museum admission, $7; people 62 and older and children, $5. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. Recorded 24-hour planetarium message. (914) 963-2139.
Art
BRIARCLIFF MANOR -- ''In the Garden,'' recent acrylics by Diane Kline. Through next Saturday. Images Art Gallery, 1157 Pleasantville Road. (914) 762-3000.

BRONXVILLE -- ''Photographic Image: A Roving Eye,'' photography by Robin Gneiting, Peter North, Lisa Sorensen, Luca Spallanzani and other photographers and vintage prints by Louis Stettner, from the estate of Lee Sievan. Through Sept. 8. Noel Fine Art, 80 Kraft Avenue. (914) 337-4050.
CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- ''Flora and Fauna,'' photography by Zelda Appleton and watercolors by Margaret Robinson. Through Aug. 12. Cornelia Cotton Gallery, 111 Grand Street. (914) 271-6802.

KATONAH -- ''Summer Light,'' featuring works by Anthony Toney, Maureen James, Margret Johnson, Jeanne Maroney and other artists. Through Aug. 27. Village Gallery of Katonah, 43 Katonah Avenue. (914) 767-0073.
KATONAH -- Photography by Michael Kenna, Bogdan Konopka, Olivier Meriel and Pentti Sammallahti. Through Sept. 27. Candace Perich Gallery, 27 Katonah Avenue. (914) 232-3966.

PURCHASE -- ''The Group: Women Artists of a New Century,'' works by Janet Bohman, Marilyn Miller, Barbara K. Schwartz, Susan Sills and Virginia Evans Smit. Through next Sunday. Manhattanville College Library. (914) 323-5277.
RYE -- ''Canvases of Rock, Earth, Wood and Water,'' nature photography by Ida Luftig. Through July. Rye Nature Center, 873 Boston Post Road. (914) 967-5150.
SPRING VALLEY -- Acrylic paintings by Juan Valoy. Through July. Finkelstein Memorial Library, 24 Chestnut Street. (914) 352-5700, ext. 243.

YONKERS -- ''Open-Air Sketching: 19th-Century American Landscape Drawings in the Albany Institute of History and Art,'' ''Fun City: Celebrating the Life of Ralph Fasanella,'' ''Boats on the Hudson: Navigating Through History'' and viewing of the restored Glenview Mansion. Wednesdays through Sundays from noon to 5 p.m. and Fridays from 5 to 9 p.m. Admission: $4; people 62 and older and children, $3. (Guided tours by a costumed guide, of the inside working of K. Whittsley, a 1930's tugboat and coffee barge. Today from noon to 5 p.m. Tickets, available at the boat: $2. J. F. K. Marina, adjacent to museum.) Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
Films
PEEKSKILL -- ''Up at the Villa.'' Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. Admission: $9. Paramount Center, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.

SUFFERN -- ''Limbo.'' Last of independent film series, presented by Finkelstein Memorial Library. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Donation: $3; students and people 60 and older, $1. Rockland Community College. (845) 352-5700, ext. 243.
WHITE PLAINS -- ''A Moment of Innocence,'' Iranian film in Farsi, with subtitles. Tomorrow at 2 and 7 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.

YONKERS -- View promotional film of 1950's trip on the Day Liner and other Hudson River adventures. Program for people 62 and older. Wednesday at 1:30 p.m. Cost: $1.50, including museum admission, coffee and cookies. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
Lectures

MAMARONECK -- Tips on saving money by Julian Block, lawyer and syndicated columnist. Sponsored by Larchmont-Mamaroneck Center for Continuing Education. Friday at 8:30 a.m. Cost: $25. Registration. Mamaroneck High School. (914) 698-3255.

MOUNT VERNON -- ''Frederick Whittaker: Custer's Controversial Biographer,'' talk about Whittaker, author of the first (and still most controversial) biography of Custer. Thursday from 11 to 11:45 a.m. Free. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 987 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

SLEEPY HOLLOW -- Readings by poets, Deborah Digges and Ernesto Mestre. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Admission: $5, including refreshments; members, $3. Hudson Valley Writers Center, 300 Riverside Drive. (914) 332-5953.
Potpourri
BEDFORD -- Hike in search of Westmoreland's 25 different kinds of ferns. Next Saturday at 2 p.m. Free. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Eighteenth-century dinners, with fiddle music, dancing and tavern games. Today and next Saturday from 5 to 8 p.m., with tours of manor house and ferry house tavern at 4. Cost: $50; members of Historic Hudson Valley, $45. Reservations required. Van Cortlandt Manor. (914) 631-8200, ext. 628.

GARRISON -- ''Shadow Portraits: The Art of Silhouettes.'' Sally Newcomb creates head or full-figure portraits of adults, children and family pets. Thursday through next Sunday from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Prices vary depending on subject matter. Reservations required. Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-3638, ext. 115.

OSSINING -- Guided tours of Wildflower Island, home to hundreds of native and endangered species of wildflowers. Saturdays at 10 a.m. Through September. Admission: $3; members, $2; Friends of Wildflower Island, free. No children under 14 allowed on island. Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.

RYE -- Tours of Peter A. Jay House, followed by lemonade on the veranda. Sundays at 2:30 p.m. Through August. Admission: $5; members and children, free. Jay Heritage Center, 210 Boston Post Road. (914) 698-9275.

RYE -- ''Language of Hats: From Poke Bonnets to Pillboxes, From Top Hats to Homburgs,'' display of 80 hats, hat boxes and hat pins from the museum's collection. Weekdays and next Saturday from 1:30 to 4:30 p.m. Through Oct. 22. Free. Rye Historical Society and Square House Museum, 1 Purchase Street. (914) 967-7588.
SLEEPY HOLLOW -- Guided tours of Old Dutch Church and its graveyard. Sundays at 2 p.m. Through October. Free. 430 North Broadway. (914) 631-1123.

SLEEPY HOLLOW -- ''Cross Roads and Cross Rivers: Diversity in Colonial New York,'' exhibition exploring varied cultural expressions made by pioneer New Yorkers, including Indians, Dutch settlers and African slaves. Daily except Tuesdays from 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Through Aug. 15. Free. Visitors center of Philipsburg Manor. (914) 631-3992.

TARRYTOWN -- Rockefeller State Park Preserve, featuring woodlands, wetlands, a 24-acre lake and 20 miles of trails (for carriage use originally) for strolling, hiking and nature study. Open daily from 8 a.m. to dusk. Parking: $4 daily; people 62 and older on nonholiday weekdays only, free. Enter on Route 117, a mile east of Route 9, to obtain trail map at visitors center. (Visitors center open daily from 9 a.m. to 7 p.m.) (914) 631-1470.

THORNWOOD -- Summer fair, softball tournament and classic-car show, with square dancing, refreshments and music. Presented by Careers for People With Disabilities. Today from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. (Rain date, next Sunday.) Admission: $3; students and people 62 and older, $2; children 9 and younger, free. Westlake High School. (914) 328-1892.

WESTCHESTER -- Sampling of farmers' markets selling vegetables, eggs, breads, flowers and organic produce. Saturdays from 8:30 a.m. to 1 p.m. Pleasantville Farmers' Market, Manville Road parking lot, off Wheeler Avenue. Saturdays from 8:30 a.m to 2 p.m. Ossining Farmers' Market, Main and Spring Streets; Hastings-on-Hudson Farmers' Market, Municipal lot off Maple Avenue, next to library and Tarrytown Farmers' Market, Patriot Park, Route 9. Small markets (with two vendors selling produce). Wednesdays from 8:30 a.m. to 2:30 p.m. At Mount Vernon's Neighborhood Family Health Center, 107 West Fourth Street and in Spring Valley at Route 45 and North Church Street. (914) 923-4837.
